intro: Rhinotropis purpusii, commonly known as the Purpus's rhinoceros plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
